alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Pendleton; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ROBERTSON, BRACKEN AND CENTRAL PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 PM EDT... At 1212 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Falmouth, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Falmouth, Brooksville, Morgan, Mount Olivet, Germantown, Browning Corner, Stonewall, Powersville, Chatham, Hittville, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Woolcutt, Neave, Milford, Greenwood, Berlin, Parina, Lenoxburg, Santa Fe and Kincaid Lake State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
